column4: are laptop wireless adapters typically change-able for other modelS? I'm wondering if I can drop in an RTL 8187B card from 1 toshiba satellite tha's dead and put it in place of this BS ATheros card that wont work in another working toshiba...
likely they are if it is the EXACT SAME model
they're not... Satellite A215 vs L25
i wouldn't swap them out.... but that is just me..... others might tell you it is ok.
I just need to get this dang atheros working... its driving me nuts
I'm dealing with a graphics issue - not the wifi issue. That's a whole other story in itself.
so setup hardward raid 0 or raid 5
hardware raid isnt an option. I either need to figure out how to do it software-wise or just continue rsyncing raw data to my backup drive
if your main drive fails, you can just boot from the rsynced one.
I dont have the rsync set up to take EVERYTHING - but I was told on forums you cant do that anyway, so I only rsync stuff in my home dir.
sure you can.... i don't think you can for /dev or /proc but you can get everything else if you run it as root
hm, really? I was told on forums that was kind of a definite no go...
root can copy pretty much anything that isn't chmoded 000. and /dev/ and /proc/ are mounted on boot....
you will need to install grub to the rsync drive's mbr to be able to boot from it.
but wait... if I DONT install grub, I could technically use super-grub t0 boot the backup drive anyway - right?
